result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew Gilbert Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any violation of probation to be reported to the Court at least 30 days prior to termination of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of probation to be reported to the Court at least 30 days prior to termination of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew Gilbert Jones

Current: 4049 6th Ave UPPER, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 5808 Pershing Blvd, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

09:25 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Mathew Gilbert Jones, appeared with Attorney Michael J Masnica.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM631/22CT198. Matters are resolved. Sentencing arguments heard.

22CM631: Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered. 

22CT198: On State's motion, counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. The court imposes sentence of 60 days KCJ; credit for 67 days served - TIME SERVED; $500 fine plus costs; pay $200 DNA surcharge; pay $65 lab costs (by stipulation of deft); bond applied, remainder to be paid 90 days or in default 32 days KCJ or work crew; 14 month revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment. 

Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice given to def. in court in Case 22CT198.

Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. 
Notice resent to new address 9/22/22.

Amount: $20.00

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Cynthia McC.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's C.M.'s residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

09:11 AM Defendant, Mathew Gilbert Jones, appeared.
Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Melina Colak.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defendant has been non-compliant with WCS in 22CT198 and picked up this case.
State's bond motion heard.
Court sets $1,000 cash bond w/same conds, def. taken into custody.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Original bond given to deputy in court.
